artists.name: Luke Davids
artists.bio: Luke Davids is a London-born singer-songwriter with piano-based songs and inventive arrangements that evoke the refined hooks of The Beatles, Billy Joel, Elvis Costello and Ben Folds Five. His music is described as “sharp, accessibly sophisticated, and refreshingly sincere.”

artists.name: Corey Congilio
artists.bio:
Corey Congilio is a seasoned guitarist, educator, and producer based in Nashville, Tennessee. Born and raised in Phillipsburg, New Jersey, he was introduced to music by his family and began playing guitar at the age of 13. After studying audio engineering at the Art Institute of Pittsburgh, he became an in-demand session player and producer.

In 2014, he moved to Nashville, where he has performed with artists such as Joss Stone, David Lee Murphy, Lucie Silvas, Radney Foster, Cassadee Pope, Derek St. Holmes, Danielle Bradberry, and Laura Bell Bundy. Corey has authored over 30 instructional guitar courses and is known for his work with TrueFire, Brett Papa, and Your Guitar Sage.

He also hosts weekly lessons and gear demos on his YouTube channel. In addition to his teaching, Corey writes and performs his own music, blending traditional blues with contemporary rock and country influences.

artists.name: Nicole Boggs & The Reel
artists.bio:
Nicole Boggs & The Reel are questioning everything. Rooted in three-part harmony and existential blues, they inject rock ‘n’ roll riffs and vindicated vocals into social commentary, holding a mirror to the absurdity of modern life.

Nicole Boggs (bass, lead vox), Alex Kramer (guitars, vox), and Sam Gyllenhaal (guitars, vox) bring drastically different personalities, philosophies and influences to the table. The songwriting team has crafted their sound by zeroing in on each other’s strengths and never shying away from hard conversations. They build common ground through the tension and release of creating together; they don’t settle until everyone is satisfied.

Growing up in musical families, they each walked solo musical paths before coming together for their first official band release, *Scenes From Last Year* in 2019. Dripping with razor-edged sarcasm, their hard-hitting follow-up EP *None of Your Business* dropped in the summer of 2020, in the depths of the first wave of Covid-19. Since then, the group has been honing their collective sound behind the scenes, quietly and diligently working on their upcoming release, *Dystopian Book Club*.

This group of unusual suspects share a love for The Beatles, books, and cultural criticism. They delight in debating the meaning of words and hold the belief that the personal is political. They are always evolving, challenging each other and reflecting the world as they see it in hope that transparency will one day shift the digital tides.

artists.name: Judy Blank
artists.bio: Judy Blank is a Dutch-born, Nashville-based singer-songwriter who blends retro soul, indie edge, and folk storytelling into a sound that’s both timeless and refreshingly modern.

artists.name: Guthrie Trapp
artists.bio: Guthrie Trapp is one of Nashville’s preeminent guitar talents, known for his taste, touch, and tone. He has performed and recorded with numerous artists and continues to influence the music scene with his exceptional guitar skills.

artists.name: Emily West
artists.bio: Emily West is a critically acclaimed singer-songwriter known for her evocative voice and compelling stage presence. Born in Waterloo, Iowa, she began her musical journey at a young age, displaying a natural talent for storytelling through song.

artists.name: Sam Lewis
artists.bio: Sam Lewis is a Nashville-based musician with a unique sound that blends Americana, blues, and soul. His music is soulful and heartfelt, with lyrics that speak to the human experience.

artists.name: Kimberly Atwood
artists.bio: Raised in the Ozarks, Kimberly Atwood's core is rooted in her small-town, close-knit family upbringing. With a blue-collar heritage and unshakable dream, Atwood moved to Nashville in 2016 to pursue her passion for singing and songwriting.

artists.name: Aaron Lee Tasjan
artists.bio:
Aaron Lee Tasjan is a Nashville-based singer-songwriter and guitarist known for his genre-defying sound that blends glam rock, indie folk, and Americana. Originally from Ohio, Tasjan built his career with a fearless, boundary-pushing style and wry lyrical wit. He has performed with the New York Dolls, produced solo albums to critical acclaim, and earned a reputation for his flamboyant fashion sense and deeply introspective songwriting.

His albums, including *Karma for Cheap* and *Tasjan! Tasjan! Tasjan!*, explore themes of identity, self-acceptance, and the ever-evolving nature of the music industry. With a loyal following and growing recognition, Aaron continues to shape Nashville’s alt-Americana scene with his bold authenticity.

venues.name: The Bowery Vault
venues.address: 2905 Gallatin Pike, Suite C, Nashville, TN 37216
